intro: Ferolia chrysophylla, commonly known as the golden leaf ferolia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes other citrus and related plants. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically harvested when fully mature. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some tropical and subtropical regions.
